q: What are home flood barriers and how do they protect my property?
a:
Home flood barriers are watertight barriers installed at entry points (doors, windows, garage openings) to prevent floodwater from entering your home during storms. Our barriers use FEMA-approved materials that can withstand hydrostatic pressure, protecting your property from thousands of dollars in water damage.

q: Do I need a building permit for home flood barriers?
a:
Permanent anchor installations typically require a minor building permit. Removable panels generally do not need permits. We handle all permit filing and coordinate with local building departments to ensure code compliance.

q: What maintenance do home flood barriers require?
a:
Minimal maintenance: rinse with fresh water after use, inspect gaskets for debris, and allow components to dry before storage. Annual gasket inspection and periodic hardware checks extend the 10-year warranty.

Gaskets typically last 5-7 years with normal use. We provide replacement parts and gasket replacement service.

q: Can home flood barriers be removed and reinstalled?
a:
Yes, our home flood barriers are completely reusable. Panel removal takes 3-6 minutes per opening. Tracks remain in place year-round (paintable for aesthetics), and panels store compactly until needed.

Many homeowners store panels in garage or basement. We provide storage tips and optional panel storage racks.
